content: initially made s then yarn over and pull through t two loops you now have one less e than the amount you had initially chained h c o r c repeat *yarn over and pull through two loops* until you e have one loop left n n a e vertical bars j the loop on your hook is the first one insert your hook under the next vertical bar yarn over and pull through one you have two loops on your hook page 3 jeanne crochets s t e insert your hook under the next vertical hbar yarn over and pull through you have three loops on your hook repeat the process c o for the last loop there is no vertical bar you can notice a loop drawrn in black on the first picture you want to insert your hook in the loop in the space between the c bottom of the loop and the straight loop marked by dots e yarn over and pull through n n you should have the same number of loops on your hook as a the number of chain you initially e made j to make the return pass follow the instructions of the previous page page 4 jeanne crochets continue until you are satisfied with the length of the rectangle make an uneven number of row it will be folded in half and be the width of your project see page 1 for reference to count your row you can count the vertical bars shown in blue or the loops on the side of your rectangle s t e h c o r the bind-off row c e n n a e insert your hook in the second vertical bar as you normaly do to sjtart a row yarn over pull through all loops you now have one loop on your hook insert your hook in the next vertical bar as you normaly do to start a row yarn over pull through all loops you now have one loop on your hook repeat until the end of the row insert your hook as usual for the last stitch yarn over and pull through all loops page 5 jeanne crochets it look like this s t e h c o r assembling the pcouch e n n a e j tthhiiss llaasstt ssiiddee iiss aallrreeaaddyy cclloosseedd bbuutt wwee llll fold the rectangle in half the right side is facing you ccoonnttiinnuuee tthhee bboorrddeerr ffoorr aaeesstthheettiicc rreeaassoonnss the black arrows show the way it is assembled using single crochet insert your hook in the first stitch from your hook and in the corresponding one on the other side going under both loops page 6 jeanne crochets s continue until you reach the other side t e make a single_crochet directly in the firsht stitch of the next side as indicated in the following picture it will created a rounded c corner o r it looks like this c e n n a e j
